item.title: Deleting all playerNames in jailed.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Olzax Olzax
item.description:
@Olzax wrote:

bbl111:

Your code is calling that a whole new file should be made, it would be easier and less space-consuming if you added the jailed status as a statistic to the character file. That way it would vary from Character to Character. ;D

i don’t understand how it is “space-consuming” if it’s 1 file. And as for it being easier, well that’s your opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting all playerNames in jailed.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Olzax Olzax
item.description:
@Olzax wrote:

I made jail command write the prisoners playername in jailed.cfg and It works. But when the unJailed() method is called instead of deleting the prisoner who is getting out of jail it deletes every name in the jailed.cfg

here is the method

[code] public void unJailed() {
File file = new File(“jailed.cfg”);

        if (file.exists()) {
            sendMessage("You have been unjailed");
            try {
                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                String unban = playerName;
                String inFile;

                while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                    if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                    } else {
                        out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                    }

                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Error unjailing user"); 	
        }
 }

[/code]
Please help.

Read full topic
